etymologies: late 19th century: from French titrer (from titre in the sense ‘fineness of alloyed gold or silver’) + -ate

definitions: ascertain the amount of a constituent in (a solution) by measuring the volume of a known concentration of reagent required to complete a reaction with it, typically using an indicator

examples.text: the sample is titrated at a pH near 10 with EDTA solution
titrate 25 cm³ of this solution against 0.10 M hydrochloric acid

shortDefinitions: ascertain amount of constituent in solution by measuring volume of known concentration of reagent required to complete reaction with it

definitions: continuously measure and adjust the balance of (a physiological function or drug dosage)

examples.text: each patient received intravenous diazepam and pethidine, the doses being titrated according to the response

shortDefinitions: continuously measure and adjust balance of
